item.title: Administering Windows Servers with FreeBSD
item.description: FreeBSD, the less talked about cousin to Linux is not only a viable alternative to both Windows and Linux but in some ways is far better than either, it really comes down to personal choice and I am slowly choosing FreeBSD for more and more of my needs. Despite this, installing a graphical desktop on FreeBSD still requires a fair amount of work and some measure of skill.Â PC-BSD, FreeBSD with KDE and a graphical installer packaged together alleviates much of the work but for those that don’t want or need the baggage that comes with KDE, installing FreeBSD and building what you want is really the best option.
